diff_hunk:
@@ -25,11 +25,12 @@ def edit
   end
 
   def index
-    if Season.current.active?
-      @projects = Project.selected
-    else
-      @projects = Project.in_current_season.where(aasm_state: %w(accepted proposed))
-    end
+    season = Season.find_by(name: params['filter']) || Season.current
+    @projects = if season.current? and !season.active?
body:
`Season#transition` is from october 1 through dec 31, and I think you want jan 1 through `active`. ? 

The way I remember it is: Use `&&` unless you have a very specific goal for `and`.  
http://www.virtuouscode.com/2014/08/26/how-to-use-rubys-english-andor-operators-without-going-nuts/
body_html:
Season#transition is from october 1 through dec 31, and I think you want jan 1 through active. ?

The way I remember it is: Use && unless you have a very specific goal for and.
http://www.virtuouscode.com/2014/08/26/how-to-use-rubys-english-andor-operators-without-going-nuts/
body_text:
Season#transition is from october 1 through dec 31, and I think you want jan 1 through active. ?
The way I remember it is: Use && unless you have a very specific goal for and.
http://www.virtuouscode.com/2014/08/26/how-to-use-rubys-english-andor-operators-without-going-nuts/
